ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Binding song..........
ygData.msgSnippet: About that binding song... this is why its a good reason to like read song descriptions to find out if they re AE BEFORE you decide to play them in a crowded
ygData.messageBody:
About that binding song... this is why its a good reason to like read song
descriptions to find out if they're AE BEFORE you decide to play them in a
crowded dungeon or well some place like Mistmoore.

Tani 21st (again) Bard
Halana 50th (I made it to the SS in Fear without dying) Shaman
Solusek Ro


-----Original Message-----
From: Nathaniel Kim [mailto:nkclark@...]
Sent: Tuesday, March 14, 2000 5:55 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Bit more on Crag Spiders at 25


From: "Nathaniel Kim" <nkclark@...>

Elijah wrote:

>Over time I have found in an all instrument attack this combo:

DDD
CoD
Largos Binding,
Hymn

keeps you more ahead of the game than swapping Purifying Rhythms for Hymn,
even when you keep the three instrument swap going.<


I wish I had thought to try that. My four song combo of choice was DDD,
CoD, Hymn and then a Bellow. I found it was adequate, but that I would go
back to the three song combo when things got hairy. I sadly underutilized
Hymn (and then Chains) for a long time, until I figured out how potent they
could be. (It probably all dates back to that bard who ridiculed me for
using the all-song combo when I was 22 and she was 28 because she "didn't
like it"...her combo of choice was hymn, chains and anthem with weapons.)

Btw, your posts are making me seriously consider making another bard on my
server (or another one, I don't care) and working him up to crags again :)

On a side note, my beloved ogre warrior is now 19 and desperately seeking
his surname. He wouldn't last very long in EK soloing crags between 22 and
26 =) (or at least I don't think he would)

Sinistral of Karana
